Entries.Mon10: A tasteless TV dinner tonight, or something I can't afford from the saloon? Choices, choices....
Entries.Tue10: There's nothing like a nice fresh parsnip.$h
Entries.Wed10: Got a hankering for some hashbrowns from the saloon, but not sure I've got the cash for that.$s
Entries.Thu10: Hey @, you any good at checkers? I used to be.
Entries.Fri10: Ugh, @, I really wish I could afford a dishwasher.$s
Entries.summer_Tue10: Gus gets up at dawn to bake bread for the Saloon. Then he's up until late bartending. I wish had even half of that man's energy and dedication.
Entries.fall_Tue10: Penny thinks I should take up playing chess or something. Find something to occupy me.
Entries.winter_Tue10: I wish I could have been a better mother for Penny.$s

Entries.winter_Mon10: Hmmm....boxed red wine or boxed white wine for tonight?

Entries.Mon10: Bus has been making weird rattling sounds lately.#$e#As they say...good enough for government work...Hrmph.$s
Entries.Tue10: Penny would rather stay home and read a book than go out.#$b#I wasn't like that when I was her age. Maybe she's got the better idea.
Entries.Wed10: Laundry, laundry, why is there always more laundry to do?
Entries.fall_Tue10: Pappy used to buy these canned glazed yams.%revealtastePam208#$e#Hey, don't knock it until you've tried it, it's better than you'd think.
Entries.winter_Tue10: Nice thing about being employed by the government...my job security is pretty good.
Entries.winter_Wed10: My biggest regret in life is that I couldn't provide a good life for my dearest Penny.$s#$b#It's probably too late now, too.$s
Entries.winter_Thu10: These old bones don't move as well as they used to.$s
Entries.2_2: Huh, Accel might be going bankrupt. Well, that's the end of an era...
